Hi $[FNAME|Multi-Etch user]$,

We want you to be successful with Multi-Etch in whatever ways you are using it, so we’ve tested it extensively on a variety of metals, both reactive and nonreactive, for purposes including anodizing, cleaning, welding prep and more. We’ve tested heated as well as room temperature Multi-Etch.
View our comprehensive etch rates charts

If your procedures are working for you, there’s no need to change anything.

We did find that room-temperature, double strength Multi-Etch, after having been activated by heating it one time, etches more quickly. When prepping for anodization or welding, we recommend starting at two minutes instead of ten.

Take a look at our full etch rates for titanium or our index of etch rates for other metals — these also include information for using Multi-Etch as a cleaner or to remove debris from some metals, and to remove anodized colors on reactive metals.

At the top of this email, you can see an image of the results of testing grade 4 titanium strips for anodizing and welding prep in room-temperature Multi-Etch. We etched for varying amounts of time, from 30 seconds to 5 minutes. You’ll notice that the high voltage pinks look great!

We hope this information is helpful to you. We’re always available if you have any questions — just reply to this email.

Happy etching!

Chris Boothe

Multi-Etch Answer Man
